item.source: Something will happen after X time

item.title: Something will happen after X time
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

silabgarza:

event’s do that same thing :lolbert:

events don’t instantiate a new thread every time you start a new event… events are sometimes ran (processed) on their own thread (synchronized), but most of the time events are processed in the server logic thread to avoid synchronization issues. I don’t mean to dig at you or anything, but if you actually think a new thread is created for every single event then you really don’t know what you’re talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: Something will happen after X time

item.title: Something will happen after X time
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:6, topic:507322”]why would you use timer/timertask??? this is what events are for :fp:

you do realize you’re creating a new thread every time you instantiate a new timer? this will also cause synchronization issues if used incorrectly… :doublefp:

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-s()erver/snippets/113949-grahams-event-manager.html
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-s()erver/tutorials/302738-cycle-based-task-manager.html

Remove the brackets ( () ) in the links. Also, everyone knows how to do this so this tutorial really isn’t needed.[/quote]
event’s do that same thing :lolbert:

Read full topic

item.source: Something will happen after X time

item.title: Something will happen after X time
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Ok so i finally know how to do this so i said why not sharing it to the people who dont know how.
Always bump it so people will not ask this shit.
so this:

public void seconds(){
	new java.util.Timer().schedule( 
	        new java.util.TimerTask() {
	        	
	            public void run() {
		addItem(1038, 1);
	            }
	        }, 
	        10000
	);
}

Thats basicly mean that if use that void (anywhere like in a command or something) it will wait 10 second (because 10000 miliesconds) and in the end of those 10 second it will give you a party hat.
Gl with this information could use alot.

Read full topic
